questions.question: How do I show a modal dialog?
questions.answer: Call `addOnUISdk.app.showModalDialog(options)` with variant, title, and description options.

questions.question: What dialog variants are available?
questions.answer: confirmation, information, warning, destructive, error, input, and custom variants.

questions.question: How do I get user input from a dialog?
questions.answer: Use variant "input" with a field object containing label, placeholder, and fieldType properties.

questions.question: What button types can be returned?
questions.answer: Dialog results contain buttonType with values like primary, secondary, or cancel.

questions.question: How do I create a custom dialog?
questions.answer: Use variant "custom" with src pointing to HTML file and optional size properties.

questions.question: How do I programmatically close a dialog?
What properties does the result object contain?
questions.answer: Result contains buttonType, and for input dialogs also fieldValue with user input.

questions.question: What are common use cases for modal dialogs?
questions.answer: Confirmations, warnings, user input collection, settings, and premium feature access.
